chapter.title: Structured Data
chapter.section:
Introduction
In the past chapter, we examined ways to process data using regular expressions. In this context, we wrote a program or script to extract the information we wanted from the data. It was up to us to identify the patterns in the text files. In other words, each consumer of the file was responsible for working out its structure and extracting the relevant data. In some cases, identifying patterns is very complicated, or even impossible. Instead, we must special case certain data or records.
What if the data was more structured and identifying patterns was easier? What if instead of each consumer having to identify the patterns and guessing the structure, we encode it in the file itself. If the data were self-describing, we would be better off. If datasets with the same structure adhered to a particular format, then it would be easy to write code that read that data.
